Description: Fragment of foot and bowl of Attic black-figured pottery tripod pyxis; interior: glazed black; exterior: on tripod leg, black-figure decoration consisting of flying bird and boy on horse to right (tip of bird's wing missing; added red on both wings; head and lower body of horse missing; rider with red hair and red horse's mane); underside black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 43, pl. XXI, no. 42)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p.327, no. B370)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1970)
